summary: This document is an FBI interview summary (302 form) of an attorney who spoke with Jeffrey Epstein by phone on August 9, 2019, two days before his death. The attorney recounts the conversation, in which Epstein discussed the press, personal matters, his jail conditions, and his legal case, and expressed love and a future intent to call again, with no indication of suicidal intent.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the phone call. He is the incarcerated individual who spoke with his attorney, discussing the press, his routine, his case, and expressing affection and future plans.

events.title: Phone Call Between Epstein and Attorney
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein spoke by phone with his attorney for approximately 20 minutes. He discussed the intense press coverage, personal topics like music and books, his jail routine and hygiene, stated 'They are trying to keep me safe,' indicated his case would take longer than expected, expressed love, and said he wouldn't be able to call again for another month.

events.title: FBI Interview of Epstein's Attorney
events.description: The FBI interviewed Epstein's attorney, who provided a narrative summary of her phone call with Epstein from August 9, 2019. She stated there was nothing in the call to indicate he had decided to end his life.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein spoke with his attorney by phone on August 9, 2019, two days before he was found dead in his jail cell.
During the call, Epstein discussed his routine and hygiene, stated 'They are trying to keep me safe,' and said his legal case would 'take a little longer than he originally thought.'
Epstein told his attorney he loved her, asked how she was doing, told her to be strong, and said he wouldn't be able to call again for another month.
The attorney explicitly stated to the FBI that 'there was nothing to indicate that he had decided to end his life' and noted 'no acrimony' in the conversation.
The attorney was willing to continue to cooperate with authorities.
